name: Giant Slayer
text:
I would like to express my sincerest gratitude to the kindness that was displayed to me by the couple who owns this business. On Friday, September 8, I ended up at this business, experiencing some very scary pain which ended me up at UAB hospital. The lady who helped me offered me her own bed to rest while I waited a couple of hours for my husband to arrive. She took care of me as if I were a close relative and went out of her way to comfort and encourage me. The owners also allowed us to keep our vehicle there for the weekend, as we were unable to pick it up until sometime later that weekend. This type of compassion and unselfishness is a rare quality in today’s world. I’m very appreciative that I happened across your business, and I’m so very grateful for how giving you were.
I realize this is not a review of the vehicle services to offer, but I believe how you treated me is a very good reflection of the type of business you run....thank you so much for your compassion and hospitality! May the favor of the Lord rest upon you and your business!

Most shops would not begin to repair an older motorcoach and for this I am grateful for their help. Will definitely take my work to Richard Parks Truck Repair again!

So after an hour of swearing, cussing and me trying to help him - he told me can’t do it. He then he proceeded to put it back on, making the whole situation now even worse - now I could clearly hear the wheel loosing air, by loud hissing sound. I lost about 2-3 hours, I got wheel back in a much worse shape and I have trailer fully loaded. Don’t take a job you can’t do, I was left strangled at night, when nobody works. Therefore I’m not satisfied with service ive been provided. If you have a problem similar to mine, I don’t think you will find help here

name: Beth Phillips
text:
It took the tow truck over two hours to after I was told it was dispatched to make a 30 minute trip. Only after giving them ample time and allowing for traffic did I call back to be told the had taken another call, one that was made after they told me the truck was on the way. Come to find out they have a contract with the state. which I understand. But if they are going to take another call and put it before mine I would think they would have the common decency to at least give me a call and let me decide if I wanted to wait three times what I was expecting. Their price was also a good $75.00 above the going rate.
I was uneducated on towing services, but now know better. I would not recommend Hank's unless you have plenty of time and don't really care how much you spend. A disaster from start to finish. Horrible business practices to leave a customer waiting all that time without at least a courtesy call.

name: Andrea Kay (Andie)
text: April 2, 2021 I was in a horrific accident, another car changed lanes into me on the interstate running me into the guardrail, which spun the car I was driving around and smashed it into the guardrail three more times. I was traveling with two dogs and hours away from home. To say I was a mess doesn't cover it. Your driver and his partner were professional, and went above and beyond helping me get myself and my dogs to a pet friendly hotel, getting all of my luggage and dogs in. Unfortunately I left the paperwork he gave me in  his truck but please know he is absolutely an asset to your business and I'll forever be grateful for the treatment and professional manner I was treated in that evening! Drivers like him are a rarety and kiddos to him!!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Andrea. You can call on us any time, and we will be there for you.

text:
They professionally picked up my car and towed it 40 miles in time for me to still go get my other vehicle and go to work.
I am very satisfied with them and will use them again.

name: Jason Dowling
text: They don’t honor the time posted on the door. I was there at 4:45, (Monday) they close at 5. I get people like to cut out a few minutes earlier sometimes, I do. I really needed some things from my vehicle, and dispatch was rude as hell. I wouldn’t recommend if you have the option

resp.text: We're so sorry. We hate to let a customer down. If you have time please call us at (205) 405-1888 so we can discuss your concerns in greater detail. We hope to hear from you. Thank you

name: David Pilgrim
text: My late father's truck got towed after 12 midnight on a Friday my son was driving the truck and went to jail , monday I called and they said 330 to get it out remind you they only towed it 2 miles when I got over there about 1 they said 390.00 they charged another 35 dollars because I wasnt there at 12 the reason and I told them I had to go to my brothers house and get my dads death certificate to get a release on it anyway the Pell city police dept said they had  few complaints on them ,I finally talk them into 360.00 but that low down shame they would take advantage of people charging that much oh it was a 100 admission fee plus 200 just for towing it 2 miles , what is the admission fee for I dont mind paying 200 towing it 2 miles which is high but then they add 100 admission fee what the hell is that for plus 35 aday storage. it should have been 200 to tow 70 storage for 2 days not 390 they wanted. that's doing people wrong and they get by with it because if you dont pay what they want you dont get your car , they got a hell of a racket going on and I'm wfiting the chief of police so they can discuss it over the next council meeting hopefully they wont be towing for Pell city a more,  and that fat boy that was there is lucky I kept my cool because I dont play no games especially when. I'm being ripped off  it was his lucky day I gave him a pass because I dont let fat boys run there mouth at me ,he must be used to talking to others like that. just beware if you call Hanks towing be ready to empty your wallet to them and that administration fee on top of towing I dont understand that ha! ha! That's a good one ,you got me this time but never again

resp.text:
Mr. Pilgrim,
All of our pricing, No matter the jurisdiction involved, Are equal in all amounts and are within regulation(s) of the state of Alabama and all local municipalities.
The administrative or "Admin" fee that is charged reflects the costs we have to pay to search within the Alabama Department of Revenue and if applicable, any other state in which the vehicle is registered, to obtain the names of the registered owner and or lienholders (If applicable) on any vehicle pulled in, Reason being as so we don't get someone coming in with a handwritten bill of sale for example, stating that they are the owner of whatever vehicle they may see in our lot is theirs, It's a safeguard measure we take to keep any customers property secure, And to ensure only the rightful owner of the vehicle is allowed to even touch it.
Your invoice copies will reflect that our storage charges are $30 per day, Which added in to your total price accrued of $360, And paid in full.
My apologies on having to meet on social media as a platform for resolution.
Please don't hesitate to contact us for any future towing needs, We'd be glad to amicably assist you in any way we can.

This is the 2nd time we have called to hire this tow company just to be left on the side of the road

We pride ourselves on maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers/clients; we hope you will give us an opportunity to discuss your concerns further with you. You can reach out to us at (205) 405-1888. We hope to find a solution promptly.

name: Brian Anthony
text:
I didn't use Hank's in the conventional sense, But my insurance (progressive) sent a driver out to my home to pick up my deer damaged vehicle and take it to Birmingham for Progressive to look at.
Your driver was Joey, And I haven't had a better experience with anyone during this period than he was. The tow truck the police called out to pick my truck were nice and quick, But when they asked where I wanted them to take it to, they seemed a little bit annoyed that I wanted it to go to my home, as I wanted to talk with my insurance agent first. I suppose they prefer taking them to their place or a body shop.
When they unloaded my truck, a good bit of the plastic from the headlight and grill fell out on the tow truck, And the driver just brushed it off into my yard where my truck was sitting. I didn't think much of it, I'd just clean it up in the morning when I went out to take pictures to start working with my insurance.
I talked to my insurance, They told me because it's a newer model truck,  That they would have someone from their salvage provider come pick it up, I believe it was 3 days later when I got a call from a lady from IIA or IAA, saying that she was about to be giving a driver the information to come pickup my truck and verified my address and the damages with me.
Not too terrible long after I spoke with her and said ok to having another tow truck company come out, Joey actually called me when he was roughly 30 minutes away from my home to verify my address and that everything was ready to go. He showed up just as he said and came to the door and got me to explain why he was there, And actually gave me the rundown on the process of what would happen if progressive did or did not total my truck. I handed off my keys to him, He went and got  his truck from the street and backed it in to where he'd be able to load it up. Before he backed up into the location, he did ask me if I had septic in the area (I I didn't)  He said he always asks when he has to enter a yard,  Said he's never had a problem with accidentally finding a tank but really didn't want to have to make phone calls explaining a problem!  LOL!
He got down under my truck and did his work with some chains, Put it in neutral to wind it up his truck and chain it down. Now, this is where I became surprised,  He picked up every piece of plastic and debris that had come from my truck and put them in the bed. I never asked him to!
I asked why he did and he said he wanted it to be just as if he and my injured truck were never there. I'm still amazed that there a people that have that mindset.
We talked for a few more minutes as he finished loading and chained my truck down, I asked where they were out of and he gave me a business card with everything on it. I'm in Chilton county, So it's not feasible for me to call a company that's an hour plus away,  But he told me that you have trucks all over the place at any given time, And to call if I needed help, That you might be right down the street!
As I said early on, I never thought that my best experience in this headache would have been the guy that picked up my truck and towed from my home to Progressive's auction yard. It ended up being totaled,  But I'm loving my new blue f150!
Thank you to Joey and Hank's!

resp.text: That is so amazing to hear, Brian! Thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback with our team at Hank's Towing Service. It's great to know that we continue to provide our customers with everything they need. Have a great day!

name: Eden Snyder
text: For anyone considering calling this place for a tow, save your time and money and stay FAR away!! We have had not one, but TWO horrible experiences with this tow service. The first time, they left my 70 year old Father stranded in 90° weather for hours on end, we have AAA and they assigned Hank's to the tow job. They accepted the job and didn't call/notify/cancel the job to give my Dad the opportunity to get another company assigned to the job, they just left him stranded!!! Then, my husband called them last night and they accepted his request for a tow directly,no AAA,  he called them himself since they were close. They told him they would be there in no more than 45 minutes. 1 hour later, no word. He calls them back, they say they took another job and would get him as soon as they finished. 3 HOURS LATER, my husband is still stranded and calls them for the third time. They end up telling him he may be better off calling another company. God forbid what would have happened or how long my husband would have waited if leaving it up to them to follow up on a service they accepted to begin with. Y'all are clearly in the wrong business, and people can be seriously hurt or have personal things in their life that an be SEVERELY affected by your negligence and lack of consideration. Thank God they weren't on their way to work or something pressing that required a timely arrival. Lesson learned. I will be sure to let AAA know to never assign this business to my tow jobs again, and I would recommend the same to all of you, unless you want yourself and loved one's to be stuck out in the middle of the night with no help or in the blistering Alabama heat. Spread the word, Hank's is not a reliable service and should not be in the business they are!

name: JL McCrary
text:
Got a price for radiator out the door.  325.00.  I said ok.  Got the radiator and was handed a ticket for 352.   Scratching my head.  Friendly people anyway. Gave 3 stars only because I expected 325 out the door. Thanks

I don't deny everyone should pay taxes.  I totally agree.  Ive been having work done through jacks since I was 16.  Approximately 40 years. Since you were located in the beautiful brick building across from east elementary school.   My question was: can you price it out the door for 325.00.  I was told yes. I figured the meant pricing the Radiator where it equal a number that allows price to be 325 after taxes.  If you had said I'm sorry you couldn't do it I would have understood.  The young man who helped me was an asset for jacks.

Example,  300 x .09 = 27.   300 + 27 = 327.

Either way.  Thank you.  I'm sure the radiator is high quality.

Not arguing.   Thanks again.

resp.text:
$325 plus sales tax = $352.63. Sorry for the confusion but everyone pays sales tax. That's the state and county taxing you on your purchase. You pay this everywhere, not just at our place.

I spoke with the guy who helped you. He said he discounted the part from $355 to $325. He did not realize until now you meant you wanted it for $325 out the door. I apologize for the confusion. If you've done business with us that long you have worked with my grandfather, my father and myself and you also know we appreciate your business and our goal is to make customers happy. I apologize that we did not live up to your expectations. Please come by the office and ask for me (Kevin) so that I can make this up to you.

text: Wouldn't take five minutes to check my radiator for a leak. One star for being polite.

resp.text: John, I'm sorry you felt the need to post a 1-star review. Out of respect to other customers with vehicles and equipment down, we can't always stop what we are doing. Your demand seems unreasonable given the fact we offer this as a free service and is very much akin to trying to cut in line at Walmart. If you have a change of heart, feel free to bring it back and leave it with us for a couple of hours & we will perform a pressure check for you.

text: I don't know where to begin I am  shocked and disgusted with the customer service received from this place.I have never been one to leave a bad review but if I could I would leave - star reviews.One of our trucks from the business was experiencing some issues so we brought it in for them to look at it.They told us that the fuel pump needed to be replaced and gave us a quote on it.We  decided to go with them even though it was way above what others quoted.Keep in mind they told us what they were sure was wrong with the truck.Few days later the give us a call stating that the turbo on the truck went out and said that in all it would be 15k parts and labor included, but they reassured  that after this it wouldn't have any more issues, a few days  go they work on the truck tell us to come pick it up that it was ready for us to take it back out on the road that everything was fixed and we didn't have anything to worry about.We drive pick up the truck 200miles after leaving the shop the truck goes out again.We decided to give to owner a call and told him that we just spent 15k on them preparing the issues his response was hanging up on a customer that spent that amount on fixing the issues that he reassured that the complications were fixed, with that being said I would not trust an owner of a business that takes 15k from a hard working family and hangs up when a customer calls to tell them they are having the same issues he supposedly fixed.He didn't fix the issues correctly and instead of trying to resolve the issues cuz I understand we are only human we make mistakes but the way he went about it was all wrong.You sir will be hearing from my lawyer !!

resp.text: I’m sorry for any problems we may have caused you. I understand your friend Leart Hasani ask you to post a negative review on our business because he is upset his truck is having problems. I can assure you that we are working with him to get his problem resolved. I have been in contact with him the last two days and we are trying to figure out his problem. We are not doing him wrong. Thanks and God Bless

name: Sonja Renea
text:
I dropped my truck off on Friday to have the crank shaft pulley replaced. I provided the part. I picked it up Monday. I could not leave because the battery was dead. Never had that problem before. RED FLAG.

The mechanic there said something ridiculous to me about all the car batteries in their lot going dead since the hailstorm, or something to that effect. I guess I'm a stupid woman and would just accept that ludicrous statement as truth. RED FLAG. He jumped me off quickly, and left me there with my hood up. ANOTHER RED FLAG.

Then we figure it out. My boyfriend noticed my brake lights were not going off. There were pieces of one of my brake light stopper in my floorboard. The other stopper is just missing. These are the parts that keep your brake lights off until you hit the brake.

So now my brake lights were draining my battery. I had no issues with my brakes or battery when I left it with them. The truck obviously had made it to their lot after the repair, but then the battery died. Any person with half a brain can see what happened here.

I contacted the owner, who defended his techs, but offered to "fix" this problem IF IT REALLY HAPPENED. Unfortunately I do not trust this shop to touch my vehicle at this point. I have not even driven it enough to know if the crank shaft pulley was installed correctly because I am waiting on brake stoppers from Nissan.

He seemed angry that I would question his "integrity"... WELL WHY WOULDN'T I?

So $113 later, my two cents: Save yourself the hassle. I was married to a mechanic for 24 years... and some of them do this to women who they assume will not know any better, so they will bring their vehicle back to be "fixed".... It's not surprising to me that these guys have a "Ladies Day" ... I bet they get a lot of repeat business. I did notice among all their suspicious 5 star reviews the few who did have a complaint were also women. Maybe they assume we need a man to TALK to a mechanic. Or they think people like me will see that they are "Christian" business and expect them to NOT SCREW ME over. I am a single mom with a son on disability... and I cannot trust the vehicle they just "fixed."

name: Taylar TLC
text:
This is an update to my original review upon receiving a call and efforts to make it right from Marc the Service Manager.  As you all know, many businesses won't even take the time to contact a lost customer.  Marc not only reached out but followed up with us to confirm we were taken care of, even though we had to pull our truck.  He made no excuses and stated that the communication errors were taken seriously and will be addressed.  Ultimately our repair had to been completed elsewhere but Williams still followed up and showed accountability.  I would be comfortable continuing to use W.W. Williams as I have at various locations.  However, I would advise that you seek assistance from Management if communication is lacking.  I wish we had done so sooner.

Be aware that every experience isn't the same.  We had a truck towed in to this location due to the good reviews and communication with the tech on our call.  We were told that our truck would be looked at first thing the following day.  Day 1, truck not looked at, we were told someone went home sick.  This was after we called to get an update.  We were told it would be looked at the following a.m.
Day 2,  I we provided the potential location of the issue after speaking with our home mechanic.  We asked how pics could be sent to get things rolling.  We emailed a pic of the part and diagnostic which was from a recent repair of another unit with the same problem.  We followed back up after not hearing anything mid day.  The truck was not looked at by mid-day we were told this time 2 people were out.
Day 3, Calls and face to face contact again resulted in no action, the truck was not looked at.
Day 4, We went to location to try to nail down a realistic expectation of when the truck would be touched.  We were told they would try by late afternoon but could not say for sure, this came from advisement with the shop supervisor.

This has been the worst experience we have had with a WW Williams which we use often locally.  Our confidence in towing the truck was due to the quality of work and professionalism we experienced in the past.  This location has not met the standard exemplified by the WW Williams name.  Truitt has not followed up with us nor provided a realistic time table to address the misinformation provided prior to the town in.  We understand staff issues occur, especially in the current pandemic climate.  However, there is no excuse for not providing updates nor treating all customers with the same level of priority.  The business is open, there are technicians present, and trucks being worked on.  Yet, we have not been serviced nor updated with an expected diagnostic date.  The cost of being out of service has been extended due to the poor service standard.  Beware before taking your truck here.  Sitting and no communication is not a reasonable expectation and very costly in trucking.

resp.text: Thank you so much for updating this and we do hope that we can do better for you in the future!

name: Bach Wilson
text:
This company took advantage of us and ripped us off.

I am a mechanic, but I don't often vacation with all of my tools, so I know what I am talking about here.

We suffered transmission problems on our motor home on Memorial Day weekend. AAA got us in touch with W. W. Williams. I described our problem over the phone to W. W. Williams. The front seal was leaking badly, our transmission was functioning normally as long as it had fluid in it, however was leaking too rapidly to drive. The mechanic on call nearly insisted that he come out and have a look at it on site, however I told him there was nothing that could be done on the side of the road. We decided we would spend the night on the side of the road and have it towed to W. W. Williams the next day.

The next day we had the RV towed to W. W. Williams. The mechanic on call insisted that we let him come out and put the RV inside the gates, even though we were not worried about it as it was a very industrial area. The mechanic came out and was nice and spent about 10 minutes installing the driveshaft since it had been removed by the towing company. We again explained and showed him the problem and he assured us that it would be no big deal for them to repair. The shop was very nice and appeared to be well equipped. The mechanic estimated 8-10 hours labor for the repair. He waited another 20 minutes for our ride home to arrive and we left.

A few days later W. W. Williams called to say that they could not repair our RV. They said that since it was leaking from the front seal, they wouldn't have the tooling. They charged $600 to tell us this, which is very upsetting because I told them that was what the problem was from square one and several more times after that. They justified their price by a minimum 4 hour charge for the guy to meet us to put it behind the gate, and then a inspection fee on top of that to glance underneath the camper. Their seasoned mechanic should have been able to make that call right away, and charging for an inspection is ridiculous as this could and should have been done by the mechanic while we were paying for his 4hr service call, he had plenty of time for that as he was with us for an hour or less. The tooling is also a very lame excuse.

This company clearly took advantage of us, and figured they could make an easy profit without having to touch our RV. Life is expensive enough as it is, we don't need to gouge each other. I am really upset that I told them our problem from the very beginning and they still put us through all of this.
call right awaycl

name: Tiffany Walls
text: I absolutely ADORE Brian and Tammy! They have serviced my Hyundiai Tucson as well as a second vehicle for our family. In August 2019, I had my AC compressor replaced. I had shopped around some other businesses (including Firestone, which I would NEVER recommend) and I was quoted a far more reasonable price for parts and labor through Brian's. Brian took the time to diagnose my issue, explain what he would do to my vehicle, how the part worked and why the part that needed replacing wasn't working properly. After the repair, Brian took the time to have me look and listen to the new part, showed me the broken part before he disposed of it and even gave me some insight to another belt that may need replacing at a certain point. They won us over with their communication, responsiveness, kindness and honesty. They have customers for life because they did such a stellar job! Wonderful experiences at this shop!

name: Ethan Lake
text: Absolutely the best experience I have had with a mechanic. I called several of the places around to see if I could bring my truck by and this was definitely the friendliest of them. Tammy answered my phone call and was beyond helpful. I instantly took the truck by and Brian greeted me as soon as I arrived. For the first time, a mechanic (Brian) actually took the time to hear me out and see what I thought the issue was. He checked various things in the truck and under the hood. He did a little tinkering and sent me on my way with no more problems! I will definitely be back, and for anyone else new to this area and looking for a place to get your vehicle fixed, go see Brian!

name: Larry White
text: Came out in a timely manner, saved me from having to get a tow truck when they have tow trucks. Didn’t just fix the problem, but also adjusted my trailer brakes bcuz he saw an axle sticking with no charge. Looked over my truck and found other problems as well. Worked all day until 4 am trying to fix my truck bcuz my driver was under a load. Checked my boxes and saw they both was low in gear oil. Topped them off and told me I had a yoke seal leak and a drive axle leak. Didn’t charge me for the oil he put in my truck. Cut down the price so I could get everything fixed bcuz he didn’t want me having problems down on the road. Sent pictures of all the malfunctioning parts and sent pictures of the new parts once installed. Called and texted the next day to make sure everything was going fine. Charged me less than what I would’ve got charged anywhere else knowingly bcuz my money was funny due to me just paying  to get my motor rebuilt by another mechanic. Told me the other problems I needed to get done in the future. I know honest mechanics are hard to come by but I have been blessed to find one and will continue doing business with this knowledgeable and honest family owned mechanic shop.  Thanks Adam!

They sent a mechanic to try and provide a solution to the problem and he had no clue what it was. I went to Firestone and merely explained what I was hearing and thats when I was advised it was the skid plate. My question is if a Honda certified mechanic heard the issue and didnt know what it was and I again, only told the gentleman at Firestone, not sure I want them servicing my car.

name: John Lohin
text: Sharon called me and told me she has a 2020 dry van trailer available. I specifically wanted a 2020 year. She told me she needed a deposit to keep the trailer for me. I sent it to her. She sent me papers to sign for a 2019 trailer, I asked her about it and she kept saying it’s the accounting mistake. They changed the papers to show the year 2020. Before my loan closing, I called her and asked her what’s the company’s name exactly so my bank could make the cashiers check. After I finalized my loan she sent me a bill of sale for a 2019 trailer. I called her and she says it is definitely a 2019. The accounting keeps making a mistake. How did they change my papers to show 2020 from the first place? She told me she could give me $400 off. I said no thanks. I’m not going to pay the same money for a 2019, when a 2019 is a few thousand cheaper than a 2020. Sharon wasn’t honest from the beginning.

name: Michelle Lauderdale
text:
Truck lost all its air pressure and wouldn’t build back up. Couldn’t hear any leaks, couldn’t see anything, disconnected air dryer lines and bypassed the dryer still no air pressure, checked air compressor for air pressure it was fine. After calling 3 other places, one of them said they were on the way two different times and never showed up, another one showed to be located in Decatur but when the mechanic called he said it was at least a 45 minute drive from Cullman for $270. plus their hourly rate, third one didn’t have anyone to make road calls as their ad stated. So, then I called these guys, they were there in approximately 20 minutes, not one mechanic but two and one was actually the owner. They didn’t waste any time from start to finish. As I started telling the issue, what I had checked and done, they started looking and checking themselves as I talked, after checking the things that would normally cause the problem, one mechanic started checking lines, then went underneath truck and started from the front within 10 or 15 minutes he decided to take the air from their service truck and the owner called the shop for another mechanic to run them a cut off valve so they could fill the air tank and release the valve and fill the lines quickly so the problem would show up, since it was bad enough that it wasn’t letting any air build up enough to be heard. The leak showed right up as soon as the valve was opened. These guys were great!!! Smart, quick, polite and didn’t act like I was just some dumb lady which I tend to get a lot of out here on the road. Also, the owner didn’t try to take advantage of me or drain my wallet dry.
If I ever break down near Decatur or have problems I’ll be calling them right off the bat, no hesitation period. If you need road service or work done call them.
Thank you guys very much!!!
Michelle Lauderdale aka “Country Girl”

name: Paul Sheppard
text: First of all, I have never left a review , good or bad until this one. Garretts accepted from me in March 2018 a check for the sum of a little over $18,000.00 for a rebuild on my 2012 Peterbuilt. Was given a 12 month warranty on engine but at 14 months and 127,000 miles later my engine went down. I had it towed to a shop for inspection of fault. Mechanic told and showed me the two head bolts nearest the fire wall that were not torqued properly. I paid their price for rebuild but did not receive in return what I paid for because head bolts that are “properly “ torqued do not just back off. I don’t know to many people that can pay over $18,000.00 for something and do not receive in return what they paid for and stay in business long after. Praise God , I am still in business by only His Grace but maybe in the future your mechanics can focus on doing it right the first time instead of bad mouthing other mechanics in your area. A proud look is an enemy to God. If you are that good then they would overlook the basic things that are so very important.........

text:

name: Joshua Schwartz (BloodPoolBoy)
text: The reviews were right. They don't even answer the phone

name: Liz Fields
text:
I was going to immediately post a review because I was so angry when we picked our RV up from them but I waited and did my research (which I should have done before I used them) and now I am posting my review. My husband and I are fulltime RV'ers so our RV is our home and my husband travels for work. So when we found out that our exhaust manifold was cracked we needed someone quickly. So without proper research we took it to these guys. They gave us a crazy estimate but was told that it was JUST an estimate, that it really depended on how hard the exhaust manifold was to remove and if any bolts broke as they were removing it. We dropped it off on a Thursday morning at 8:00 a.m. On Monday at noon my husband was informed that the parts were still not in. Then on Monday at 4:00 p.m. my husband was told that it was ready to be picked up. Since we were over an hour away we told them we would pick it up on Tuesday. My husband was also told that the final bill was $2,990.00. WHAT??? We were flabbergasted because they had told my husband that the exhaust manifold came off easy and that no bolts had broken. My husband talked to the service manager and disputed the bill but the service manager would not budge so in order to get our RV back we had to pay it. Then I did my research and talked to several other diesel mechanics and also talked with some other freightliner and cummins mechanics and was told that they seriously overcharged us for the work that is shown on the bill. The bill states the following "Pulled unit in shop. removed turbo and exhaust manifold. Cleaned the head and the turbo. Installed and torqued new exhaust manifold and turbo with all new gaskets and bolts. Cleaned inside and out. Ran unit. Checked for leaks none found. Parked unit." They charged us $175.00 an hour and claimed 14 hours worth of work for a total labor cost of $2,450.00. No mention of any problems whatsoever in removing the exhaust manifold. In my talks with other diesel mechanics I was quoted anywhere from $1,200.00 to at the most (from another freightliner mechanic) $125.00 an hour for labor. And that it should not have taken 14 hours to do the job if there had been no problems. Another mechanic I spoke with said that if the parts were not there at noon but it was finished at 4:00 then it took them at the most 4 hours to "install and torque the new manifold and turbo with all new gaskets and bolts. Clean inside and out. Run unit. Check for leaks and park the unit." That would leave 10 hours for them to remove the exhaust manifold and that is overboard, especially since there were no issues in removing it. I was given some great advice and I am pursuing this. I was told that in order to hold the Freightliner name that they have to abide by a "Labor Guide" and to ask to see it (but we had already paid and picked the RV up so I was too late in doing that) so I have requested the labor guide requirements for this type of job. I have also requested quotes from other diesel mechanics based on what they said they did via the bill. And have contacted the main Freightliner offices. It is sad that we as consumers can not completely trust that we won't be screwed when we take our property to people.
On top of all of the above, when we were ready to leave my husband asked for the key and lo and behold they had lost it. They could not find the key to our RV. Really?? What kind of business that works on vehicles loses keys? It was a good thing that we had another key with us. I would recommend to do your research before you make a quick decision like we did.

name: Scott Dockham
text: Very low key Frightliner. They did get a good price on a radiator.

text: Didn't greet me when walk thru door. Phones just ring while on personal phone list goes on. Worst service every @ this location but great job on my truck.

resp.text: Sorry about the customer service at our store, Gerald. Feel free to reach out to me directly to further discuss this matter. Thank you for your feedback, as we are always striving to offer the best customer service at all of our locations.

name: Kathy Morrison
text: Truck in shop from Thursday to Tuesday with DEF issues. Replaced one box and next day same issues came back. Another freightliner shop replaced the DEF sensors and problem went away. Also, closed on weekends.

name: Casey Tarantino
text: I don’t want to give them one star. They hurt us financially in the worst way. They are liars and thieves. My husband went to work for WTI in Alabama. Their repair shop is in cahoots with the Freightliner in the same town of Tuscaloosa. Just after a 90 day inspection my husband switched to WTI. They immediately on first day said there he needed over 6000.00 in repairs on his truck. We had no choice st the moment but to get it repaired where he could start work. Freightliner started repair on it. Finished it in THREE WEEKS!! So my husband was out of work for over 4 weeks due to this scam. After he was up & running again here in Pensacola we had to put it in the shop at Freightliner. After a week they found out that none of the parts had been replaced or were either old parts. It took another week to get it approved to not have to pay for the parts and labor on what was done! Then the manager in Pensacola found out that the Work was not even done by a licensed Mechanic in Tuscaloosa!!  Then of course the Pensacola Freightliner found some more things wrong of course. Like they always do. Sigh * we were out of work over 6 weeks due to this. I contacted the owner of the three Freightliner owned by him. One in Tuscaloosa and two in Atlanta area. He wouldn’t call me back at all. If we had had the money and time we would’ve had an attorney. Stay away from WTI in Tuscaloosa & FREIGHTLINER in Tuscaloosa. For the most parts there are is a lot of crookedness at Freightliners some more than others but TUSCALOOSA is the worst!! STAY AWAY!!!

text: This place was the absolute worse place I ever been to for car repair service. They were very unprofessional. They lied to me and told me my services would be covered under warranty. They said they called and then told me later warranty was not covering. My car went into the shop running and was there for 3 weeks. When I tried to go get it now they are saying it needs a whole new motor. It was so many levels to this, but I would never in my life ever buy a Dodge and I will never go to that dealership again. text: automation is awesome! they bought my vehicle and found the exact suv I wanted!! Alexis was so sweet, and oh so helpful!

name: Jackie Camp
text: When my 2014 Chrysler 200 needs service I take it to AutoNation because they are professional and they check everything to make sure no issues arise.  When it's going to be a long wait they come and let you know were they are on each step of repair.  They always have coffee and water if needed.  They also check on recall parts so you want have to come back they fix it doing your service visit.  They always offer other discounts on oil changes, tires and other necessities.  I wouldn't take my Chrysler anywhere else.

name: Matt Montenegro
text: Some of the most sleezy people that give all car sales men a bad name. Purchased a used vehicle from this dealership in May of 2020. I was sold when I was told that my vehicle had an Auto Nation warranty of "90 days or 4,000 miles." Sounds great doesn't it? Well after being hurried along in signing paperwork so the vehicle could be mine I was very happy with my purchase. However, less than a month later, and still well within my "warranty" coverage period I got a Christmas tree of lights on my dashboard. I was told to take it to its dealership and from there I could then make the claim. When I called to make the claim, Auto Nation's warranty service said there was no vehicle with my VIN in the system. I then called the manager there who told me, "I never signed any contract stating I had a warranty and it doesn't matter what I was told because it isn't in writing." I realized the manager was right about this however, I was being told one thing then they intentionally rushed me through signing paperwork so that I wouldn't catch that I never signed anything for my "warranty". The deceptive methods of these people shows that they are talented at one thing and, one thing only and, that is lying to people. These people are clearly slimy and cannot be trusted, save yourself the hassle and do not purchase a vehicle from here. Learn from my mistake, don't come here. Where ever you do go, whatever you are offered make sure it is in writing!!!!

name: William Mott
text: The two service advisors I usually deal with are Michael Robinson and Ken Baker; they are always friendly and helpful. I dropped off my truck for service (oil change, tire rotation, etc.) and Ken Baker called back to notify me that my vehicle was ready. As far I know, the work was done satisfactorily.

name: Charles Bailey
text: I’ve never had any problems with them. Good quality work on time. They’ll tell you if something else needs to be looked at.

text: I have purchased 3 Vehicles from this Dealership with my Husband and have had the same salesman Austyn ! He is Humble and Honest and that means a lot these days when purchasing a vehicle. They met my expectations and we will continue to buy from here as long as he is there. The best experiences I have ever had at any Dealership and I have bought many vehicles in my lifetime!!! Thank you Austyn you Rock !!!

name: Alfonso Packer
text: Consumer service was very poor. Upon arrival to pick up my car after recall work I had to stand in the lobby for 20mins before I was even acknowledged to get help. Then the service guy who said he had my paper so he would him me continued a phone call for an additional 30 mins. It didn’t bother me until I heard the conversation, which seemed personal not AutoNation business related, so I decided to go to parts while I waited to get so things. That department was great. After finishing up he still was on phone so I went to someone else to see if I could be helped then he decided to pull up my paperwork and noticed it was a recall job and only need a signature and to hand me my keys. I will never probably use the service department if that was a example of the customer service to expect.

My car was there for 2 days just to get the battery changed (I kid you not). Now I’m waiting on a part for my car and dear lord you would think they had to actually build the part themselves. I’ve been told 3 different stories about this part. I’ve had my car for almost 4 years now and EVERY SINGLE TIME I’m in there someone is upset about how they run this place. Now I’m that someone. So honestly never doing business with this dealership ever again. I suggest everyone get oil changes at Honda rather than this dealership... buy your cars somewhere else, the bad service outweighs the quality of their trucks.

name: Dana Adcock
text: 10 years ago we bought a new Jeep Grand Cherokee.   No one has ever touched this car but Auto Nation.  A couple months age my husband took the car in for repair.  A new condenser had to be installed.  After the work was completed, when we picked the car up, the dash lights were out.   We were told there would be an additional $300 or more to fix it.  This was very shabby business as it was fine before the work was done.   I’ve had a couple of issues with this establishment but let it go but this is going to far to expect us to pay for something that was broken while a very expensive repair was being done on the car.

text: Sid was very helpful throughout the whole process of repairing my wife’s vehicle through the extended warranty.  He spent time on the phone dealing with my warranty company and when it came time he even drove me in his own vehicle to the rental company.

name: Diane Krause
text: I took my car in for repair of the power adjustment on the driver seat. The service rep who took care of me made the scheduling and check-in nice and easy and arranged for the shuttle service to take me home. I was disappointed that the AutoNation website didn't allow me to schedule an appointment for repairs online (only maintenance services could be done online). I got a diagnosis and repair quote within a day, but word that it would take a week to get the part in. It turned out to be an additional day for the part to arrive, and I was told the car would be done the following day, but  it took two more days for it to get done. We came from the Houston area where we were used to parts being accessible more quickly, so this wait time may be normal for the Mobile area. The pickup experience was a bit frustrating. I picked up on a Saturday and waited 1 hour 15 minutes to get checked out (was told the car was ready but paperwork had to be done). The service rep kept getting pulled away by walk-ins, phone calls, and I'm not sure what else, but it seemed I kept getting bumped to the back of the line. There may have been more legitimate reasons for the long wait time, but those weren't shared with me. Everyone was nice and helpful, and my car was repaired, but the wait times were a bit disappointing.

name: LJ Pack
text: These people have communication issues. We went to make a deal on a used vehicle. We almost made the deal twice. After making our down payment and payment requirements very clear, the sales persons involved went to get approval. When they returned, the vehicle had been discounted, but they added a "fee." That's the only thing he would say, "a fee." They were trying to deliberately be vauge and, in our opinion, dishonest. After discussing their "fee," we never actually achieved full disclosure. We were told the vehicle was at a different dealership within our city and we could go there to finalize the deal. They said that they would call ahead and we should just go over there. Our credit had already been run multiple times, and we had received approval from the credit company. With this in mind, we went to the other dealership location. As we arrived at the other location, they hadn't been given all the details as we had been led to believe. So the process began again, running in circles of double talk and running our credit again... We left at closing time and expected a phone call the next day to complete the deal... That has yet to happen days later. I used to have great respect for Greenway Automotive. It appears that Greenway has only taken over these dealerships at face value, and the same crooks that were already in place are still running things just like they always have. Avoid Greenway Honda in Florence, AL, and Greenway Chevy in Muscle Shoals, AL, if you are planning to make a deal on a used car. They are not to be trusted unless you have the cash to pay up front or your own financing.

resp.text: LJ, we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience. This is not the level of customer service that we strive to provide at Greenway. We take customer satisfaction very seriously and we hope to have another opportunity to show you that. Should you wish to discuss this matter further, please feel free to reach out to our General Manager, Jesse Gouvin, at jessegouvin@greenway.com. Thank you for your patience.

text: This is one of the most aggravating, frustrating experiences I’ve had in a longgg time! I took my car to Kia because my air wasn’t working they kept my car for a day and a half. I got my car back the air was working fine. I didn’t pay anything. About a week later I went back in for my follow up appointment because I was informed to bring the car back so they could check my Freon levels. I took the car back and the rep that car up to me informed me it would be 139.00 for a diagnostic reading. I got upset because if you charge to do a diagnostic reading why wasn’t that service performed the first time. I ended up getting a phone call back from a guy named Jaizon, that apologized about my previous encounter with the pricing and he informed me I wasn’t supposed to pay anything for the diagnostic fee.  I took my car back to the dealership and left it. A few hours later I get a phone call from a totally difference representative that tells me I’m going to have to pay 280 dollars for them to figure out what’s wrong with my car. I informed them to have my car ready for me to pick it up then five minutes later the same rep called me back and stated they would knock 100 dollars off of the 280 to make it 170 for the diagnostic fee. I’ve gotten literally four prices for simply finding out what’s wrong with my car. I’ve wasted my time, and gas by making trips up there that was a complete waste of time! I’ve gotten more lies and inaccuracy from this company than any other company in Huntsville thus far. And I’ve only been in Huntsville about 2 years. They will NEVER have to worry about me bringing my car there again. That’s for sure! Giving them one star is too much credit, I wish I could remove it too!!! If you thinking about going DONT DO IT!!!

text: Excellent service. Great folks to work with.Quality work with quick turnaround.  I recommend this auto service to everyone on the capital district area.

text: Went here with a truck, had tire fixed in a reasonable time. Staff was friendly and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you, let us know if we can help in the future.

name: Kevin Krouse
text:
Disclaimer: This is not intended as bad mouthing. It is purely a report of the facts.*** Okay, I literally walked into the shop. The employees were not rude, so a plus for that. I asked for a quote for Rancho shocks (all four) for my 2001 Dodge Ram 1500. They wanted to sell me each shock for $175/piece. Yes, $175 for one shock X4. Additionally they wanted to charge $14.96 for shop supplies. $715 for parts (including shop supplies...) On top, they wanted $296.97 for labor to install the shocks.

Bottom line: Those shocks are going for $75/shock on Amazon. I understand and support a small mark up. Everybody must make money. However, charging $100 for mark up?? I recommend military personnel boycott this place. I have no bias against this place. I'm not from here, and have no past dealings with them. That is all.

I've attached the estimate for your viewing pleasure.

resp.text: Mr. Krouch, we apologize for your experience. That is not how we do business. We support our military 100%. We would like to have the opportunity to make it right. Please, give us a call or come by during business hours today and we will do our best to make it right.

name: Alice Yelder
text: Had a f250 lifted on fri may 31, I was very disappointed I wanted truck lifted because it was scrubbing, the people there lifted truck like I asked but truck tires were still scrubbing so we asked why someone didn't call since that was the reason we took it there, they weren't concerned about the quality of the work or did it solve the problem they just took the money. This was the first and last time we will ever use them. There expertise should've been used and should've reached out to us and have customer service and just plain sense but all they could see was money. What about fixing the problem and all they could tell us was "we did what you asked", what great regard for customers

resp.text: We’re very sorry that you feel like you had a bad experience. We strive to have good customer service. Give us a call Monday morning or if you’d like, we can call you and we will do what we can to change your experience.

name: Majyst Thalsbane
text: The service was great. I replaced all tje suspension components on my car o er the weekend. I came in and wanted a performance alignment specific to my car and suspension setup. They were able to get extremely close to the measurements, which is normal as all cars are not capable of achieving the perfect requirements. The technician that worked on my car "fixed" a few issues from the work and informed me of the issues. This was a free set of extra eyes. The price was reasonable for the work performed, they basically had to 4 wheel align twice because of the extensive work done to the suspension.  I definately recommend Performance Auto Repair. I will be bringing my other project cars here for similar service.

name: Brian Barth
text: Aaron and staff are great to deal with. Always take our company trucks there and are very pleased with their service. Anything we ask for they always are there for us. Thank you guys!

resp.text: Mr. Barth, Thank you for the review. It is our pleasure taking care of ALL of your fleet maintenance needs.

name: Troy Brown
text: Cant fix foriegn cars

resp.text: Mr. Brown, we are sorry that you did not have a 5 Star experience with Performance Auto Repair. You can give us a call at 334-260-3582 and we will try to help in any way we can.

name: Thomas Davis
text: Had a bad experience was going to work when my box truck lost electrical power and went dead Lawrence Robinson service advisor said it will be $640.00 to fix it was a month for them to call and say it was the alternator and called back saying that thay was trying to crank it and even trying starting fluids which is not good for diesels now truck needs a starter and flywheel that it will $2,500.00 it cost me $640.00 to get my truck back not fixed now i have more problems than i started with

name: Jack Harrington
text: At times my pickup would misfire and lose power. After reading my Nissan check engine light code, Performance Auto Repair replaced the catalytic converter. The check engine light was not on and the truck had a lot more power. However, the truck continued to occasionally misfire and start loosing power. This would last from 1 minute to several minutes before resuming with good power. Without any engine codes indicating the issue, they continued to search for the problem.  The pickup is now repaired and I can't remember when it has run so well. The total cost of repair was most reasonable for what they did.  Thank you Performance and especially Lawrence!  I will be using them for future repairs/service. I will recommend to friends.

name: atcarter75
text: Greated at the door immediately, and the staff had expert advice.

resp.text: Thank you, we're here to help if we can.

name: Bob Atchison
text:
Prior to my recent visits I’d never used this business.  When I walked in I was greeted by no less than two people.

Zack greeted me and asked how he could help.  From that point forward he was very accommodating and helpful.  He would pull the products up on the computer that I was interested in and show me what they looked like on the vehile.  He made excellent suggestions and made it easy to get just what I needed.

The prices were good and the service excellent.  I would highly reccomend Proformance Auto Repair.  Ask for Zack and you’ll be sure to receive excellent service.

Bob

name: Jamie Jamison
text: I have dealt with mostly Lawrence. He is one of the most concerned, considerate and professional sales and service providers at performance.  I would highly recommended this company to anyone. Especially military.  I am retired military to include law enforcement. This is a great company.  Keep up the grand work.

name: Michael Britton
text: These guys take care of my work beast. No matter the repair or maintenance issue. I’m in and out with little to no interruption of my work day. This place rocks. I was allowing Gipson’s to do my service work. I will never allow that to happen as long as Performance is open for business.

resp.text: Mr. Britton, thank you for the review and for your business. It is an honor to take care of your vehicle and at Performance Auto Repair we take pride in doing so in a timely manner and for a fair price.

name: Terrence Coleman (tcoleman701)
text: Was having problems getting my Putco Switchblade Tailgate Bar installed at other places (the dreaded "we only service or install what we sell" spill). However, the guys at Performance Auto were more than willing to install it and my Tailgate Assist on my 2016 Ram 1500 without hesitation and they performed an excellent job! I made sure to get a business card because I most definitely will be a regular customer! Awesome group of guys! Highly recommend for all of your auto needs!

name: Whitney Banks
text: Remember the $400 your company took from me by the second visit for one wheel bearing? Well, I’m being told that the bearing is still bad.

resp.text: Ms. Banks, we strive to perform quality work and make sure that our customers are happy. If one of the wheel bearings that we replaced back in 2017 is bad, it could possibly still be under warranty. Give us a call at (334) 245-6600 and we will gladly set up an appointment for you to come in and we will check it out for you.

name: Rob Rance
text: I strongly recommend this place.  You can find what you want for your truck at reasonable prices with great service.  Their auto technicians are qualified and skilled.  They do both car repair and truck repair which I didn't know till I visited.

name: Tina Stanley
text: My family takes all of our automobiles to Performance Truck & Automotive.  The staff there is very professional, courteous and friendly.  They  always provide quick and great service.  They go out of their way to provide excellent customer service.

name: Audrae Mayo
text:
My boyfriend and I traveled from Kansas City to Montgomery, AL for a business trip last Friday and Saturday.  Unexpectedly, our front brakes went bad, really fast.  I found them by Google, took it in without an appointment on Saturday morning and was done and out within 1.5 hours.  Very friendly and professional.  I did not feel like they were taking advantage of "out-of-town, desperate" travelers.
Lawrence was very helpful, courteous and genuine!!!!  I even received a follow-up call to make sure everything was good and that we made it home safely.  THANK YOU!!!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

name: S D Butcher (AdventureFamilyInMotion)
text: AWESOME work! Wonderful staff! We looked at the local reviews online before choosing Performance Truck and Automotive Repair and their reputation is legit! Fast, precise, and friendly! There is even a toy chest with toys for kids to play with! I will be back!!! Thank you for your work!

text: Just got brand new tires on my 13 Jeep JKU. The guys here did an amazing job, correctly on the first time. Ill definitely be coming back for any more work done to my vehicles.

They communicate clearly my vehicle repair needs, offer fair pricing and the best part is they pick up my vehicle and bring it back when they are done.

text:
Amazing service and amazing people. You can't beat them. My truck is driving and shifting great.
Thanks for the help.
J. Chapman

name: Lynn Henry
text: I have been very impressed with Performance Truck.  They know a lot about fixing cars and work on them till the job is finished.  Their customer service is excellent and everyone that I have met there is friendly and nice.  Great folks!

text: Go to vendor for just about everything including light body work. Can't speak highly enough of the service. Would recommend to anyone. I take my personal vehicles and all of my fleet vehicles over.

name: Mike Dean
text: I sat in the lobby for an hour and a half before they told me that they didn't have my size tire and that they should be here any moment. Could have told me a lot sooner. Poor customer service. Will not go back. UPDATED!! I received a call from Lawrence shortly after posting my review. He apologized and was very swift in taking care of me for my inconvenience. That is how you manage your business. They will continue to get my business. Highly recommended! Thanks Lawrence.

name: Venessa Menefee
text: My experience at Performance was superb! The people were very professional, knowlegable and courteous. I trust their work and opinion when it comes to my vehicle. I will come back when I am in need of any type of service on my vehicle.

name: Bonnie L Temple
text: Large regular maintenance time in Santa Fe.  Kept me informed and gave me estimate.  Enjoyable conversation with young man waiting.  Overall pleasant.

name: Dave Ely
text: My Subaru broke down on interstate 65 and AAA had my car towed to this shop.  After a 3 hrs wait for the AAA truck Lawrence saved the remainder of the day.  We had discussed by phone that my fan belt had broken; he took my vehicle information, ordered the part and had it delivered as we waited to arrive.  When we finally got to the shop they recommended a couple of near by restaurants and offered us a ride.  While eating they called to tell me the idler pulley seized and needed replacement.  We returned from lunch and with about 20 more minutes the car was ready to go.  I'd certainly return to this shop for repair work.

name: Lamon Logue
text: Outstanding service !! I was traveling through Montgomery Alabama and my fuel line busted. I almost made it to their shop breaking down just a block away. The service men where very courteous and made arrangements to get my truckto the shop. The rrepair was a difficult one due to the location of the line.They were extremely nice offering me and my girlfriend cold water on this hot summer day even arranged for us to get lunch. For me this is business done right. I wish they were local to me.

name: amanda smith
text: Lawrence, Aaron, and their team at Performance Auto Repair took an unfortunate situation and provided excellent service.

resp.text: Ms. Smith, I’m sorry for any inconvenience. Please email me at aaron11sprayberry@gmail.com and I will send you my phone number or you can email me your phone number so we can try to get this situation fixed ASAP.

text: I have used PTAR for more than 10 years for  my company and private vehicles for tires, periodic maintenance, as well as auto repair.  The staff is courteous and the mechanics treat your vehicle as if it was their own.  When service is required, a simple phone call will get your vehicle picked up, serviced and returned.   Service like that is hard to find these days.  Absolutely five stars for PTAR.

Great service

I am moving to NC and one thing I will regret is having to go through the hassle of finding another honest mechanic shop to service my automotive maintenance needs.  Great people, honest service.  Need I say more !!!!!!!  hey, they had breakfast the Tuesday I got my oil change and yesterday the coffee was good while they fixed a leaking tire.  Just a small screw in it.   But hey, it's fixed now.

text: These people really know what their doing and they are fair.  They told me up front what it would cost to get the job done.   Instead of cashing in, they explained that my truck was worth a whole lot less than the cost of the repairs.  Of course I did the google thing and started to research all they had told me was wrong with it.  Comparing Ebay prices and the average cost of labor in my area, and the book value of my car.  They were right.  The repairs would have cost more than the truck was worth. They saved me from the money pit that was my car.  I will be returning with all of my car maintenence and will highly recommend their team to anyone needing a honest mechanic.

Because of their great service and quality I trust no others with the maintenance of my home hauler.

By the second day some of the staff even remembered me/my name and made it a point to talk to me. I really appreciated the determination of the service team to find out what was wrong with my car and fix it accordingly. I'm from out of state so it was so wonderful to feel at ease with getting my car fixed. I wish I was from the area so I could go here regularly!

name: Joshua Pleasants
text: After going to many dealerships and being humiliated, I found myself here. I worked with Karley and she was literally the NICEST person I have ever met. She didn't haggle me. She didn't force me to do anything. And best of all, I felt as if I was part of the Adamson family. Everyone here was very nice and made me feel at home. From beginning to end, I was satisfied with the customer service. They were willing to go out of their way to ensure that I got what was best for me. If you're looking for any car, come here and talk to them and they will treat you as part of the family!

name: Brian Brocato
text: Quick service. Jessica kept me informed throughout the repairs. I will go there in the future if needed.

name: Lady S.
text: Mark was awesome, he made me feel like I was his top priority! And I really appreciate that! And all of the other staff members I encountered were very nice and sweet as well. I would bring my car back for future services. Thanks guys!

name: James Younger
text: Stivers Ford of Birmingham had the exact vehicle I was looking for, I had been looking for about a week for me a GT Mustang. Eugene Jones was the Salesman that helped us out with locating, prepping and fueling our ride up. He was more than helpful, he made us feel like family. Then we moved on to the financing department where Shelby Parker took care of our loan for the vehicle. He went out of his way to find us the lowest apr, and set us up with a service plan to cover everything for the next six years. I would highly recommend this dealership to anyone looking for a new vehicle, I drove five hours to get mine and would do it again.

name: Lance Huffstutler
text:
This place is unlike many dealerships in the area. The sales manager and sales people are genuinely great. Avery Blackall, in particular, was a great guy to work with when trying to find a new car. He found a car that met my price point, however, I wanted something similar to what I was currently driving and not go down in the value I perceived. He was part counselor, stress reliever and provided a very optimistic view to car buying. The manager was extremely fair in my trade in, something I haven’t been able to find with other dealerships. Usually dealerships ding you for everyone imperfection, but they gave me a fair trade in value and even helped by a few thousand to try to get this sale done.

I got a call a few days later, and Avery got me back in. It still was not my price point but met a lot of my needs in a vehicle. They also gave me an extremely generous offer on my trade in and got me an excellent deal. Overall, I think out of the four cars I’ve purchased, this has got to take the best experience I’ve had. I think the sales guy and the manager made this the best experience.

name: Erick
text: Ed at Stivers Ford made my experience delightful. He was helpful, knowledgeable, professional and knowledgeable. I will most definitely bring my car back. Thanks Ed!

name: Carol Lowry
text: My brother and I had a very pleasant experience purchasing a car at Stivers Ford, Birmingham yesterday.  Cody Banks was very helpful and a pleasure to do business with.  We feel like we were treated with respect and we were able to purchase a car that will suit my brother's needs.  Overall it was an enjoyable experience and everyone was very helpful and nice.

name: Shanita White
text: My experience at Stivers Ford was great! Everyone in the service department was very helpful especially Jessica at the front desk. She made sure I was updated on any problems with my car from the time I dropped off my car until the services was completed. I will definitely come back in the future.

name: Braden Smith
text: I worked with Ashley Andrews when picking out my most recent vehicle. Ashley was very friendly, courteous, and attentive. Would consider buying with Stivers Ford in the future. The price I paid was competitive to other dealerships in the area.

name: Greg Gibbons
text: Had a mechanical malfunction on my F-150 while on a trip.  Service I received at Stivers Ford, particularly from service advisor (Mark), was outstanding.  Got me in promptly, diagnosed and repaired the problem, and back on the road in about 4 hours.  Truck running fine since so diagnosis/repair seems accurate.  My thanks to everyone.

name: Tony Rucker
text: Got a great deal from Sparky on April 2, 2021 on a 2020 Ford Fusion Titanium. Very pleased with the helpful and cordial staff. Kudos to Sparky Sparks,  Shelby Parker and the Gen. Sales Mgr., Edward Pyle. We hope to do business again!

name: Chris Parker
text: We used Stivers Birmingham location and had Darrius Conner as our salesman. And after going to 2 other dealerships, Darius was able to get me in my new Bronco! Couldn’t have had a better experience and will definitely be using them for any car needs in the future.

name: H Stallworth
text: The service was great. Jessica the person at the service desk was great.She was very helpful and knew lots about my car maintenance. The only thing the price was much more than I expected. I have been going there for years when it was Adamson Ford.  I will definitely continue to go for all my service needs.

name: Angie
text: The service at Stiver’s Ford was amazing and efficient. I had my car fixed and repaired in a short amount of time. Mark, my service advisor, kept me informed almost daily with information about my car and the repairs. They did a really great job and it was reasonably priced for what I had to have fixed. I will definitely go back in the future for my car maintenance and any repairs.

name: Shavonne Askew
text: Mr. Eugene Jones was so wonderful to work with. He was really thorough with my vehicle of interest and I left with my desired choice. Thank you!

name: Lawrence McKiernan
text: Tim and his team were great in the service department.  They diagnosed the rotors and replaced them for a very fair price.  We love Stivers Ford!

name: Andy Rocks
text:
Mr. Mark was helpful, knowledgeable and prompt in getting my oil service done in time. I liked the part where another advisor tested the car’s battery right in front of me and even provided a printed report copy informing me that it was part of their precheck and from
that report I shouldn’t be having any issues anytime soon. Awesome folks out there.

name: lakeguygb
text: Purchased vehicle online - Communications was good throughout. Saved me a 7 hour round trip. Did paperwork at home when they delivered and they took the trade in with them. A follow up a few weeks after the sale would have been a bonus. Delivery driver was also very polite !

name: Russell Pruitt
text: I was helped immensely by service advisor Tim, who made certain I understood what was happening and would be happening with my vehicle.  Most importantly he returns my phone calls with the information I have requested.  Thanks Tim

name: Jack Womack
text: My 2017 Ford Expedition had some service needs so I took it to Stivers Ford because it was close to my place of employment.  Even though I didn't purchase the vehicle from them, Gerald in the service department was quick to attend to my needs and also took care of some other items that I was not even aware of.  Because parts had to be ordered and my vehicle had to spend a few nights with them, Gerald offered me a brand new Explorer to test drive so I had a means of transportation.  As a result of this excellent customer service, my next Ford will be purchased from Stivers.

name: spencer fortney
text: Ed in the service department was great! He explained and kept me informed on everything that was going on. Overall was highly satisfied with both the customer service and the work that was done on my truck. Will be using them in the future.

name: Bill Cain
text: Shelby Parker was amazing to work with. First visit and had Points from my initial purchase of my new Ranger. Had no idea how to use them. Shelby Was able to to explain and direct me on how to use points so I could add a tool box to my truck. Very friendly as all the folks there were. Called me next day to let me know my toolbox had already come in. Shelby was a pleasure to work with and I’ll definitely be back for all service needs.

name: R.M. McRae
text: Shelby Parker with Stiver’s Ford in Birmingham was excellent in her service as was all of the service personnel. Shelby processed both my F250 diesel and my wife’s Ford Edge simultaneously and our wait time was minimal. A great department in downtown Birmingham to have your vehicles serviced. Five stars for Shelby and her co-workers at Stivers!

name: Allison Cervantes
text:
UPDATE: Now I CAN say something about the dealership...They say they'll contact you, but they never will. They really don't care.

Can’t really say anything about the dealership itself but a huge word of caution to avoid Sparky Sparks. He’ll promise things he can’t actually do and waste your time.
Called at 8:45am saying I was interested in purchasing a vehicle that same day and he was aware I was coming from Metro Atlanta. Thought he was being super helpful because he even texted me through personal phone. I called him not even an hour later to double check if the vehicle was actually available and about different payment options so that I would come prepared. He answered that he’d keep the keys in his pocket and made sure the vehicle was put aside not to be sold. Kept in touch the rest of the day and he asked me for my eta, let him know I was an hour away and he responded with “cool!”. I arrive to the dealership and walk in to speak to him and he is still being kind and telling me he was going to finish up with other customers and to wait outside. When he finally gets to me he has the audacity to tell me if there’s another vehicle I’d like to purchase saying he can give me the biggest discount of my life because he just sold the one I was interested in 30 minutes ago. Please ask for a different salesman that won’t lie to you!!!

resp.text: GSM Ed Pyle will reach out to you to discuss your visit and concerns.

name: Dennis Krantz
text: Having a firm reservation to get my vehicle serviced saves me time. I especially like it when I get there and Mark, my service writer knows my name. He and others on the staff recognize me as a loyal customer. While my vehicle is serviced, I sit in Stivers' clean waiting room and read a book. Stivers personnel always greet us as they  walk through the room. Finally, checkout is fast and easy and my vehicle is waiting for me. I love my Ford Escape Titanium and the service at Stivers Ford.

name: T B
text: Just picked up my new F150 full hybrid 4x4.  The staff of Shelby, Cody and David were awesome.  Very honest and professional.

name: Colton Spain
text: Amazing experience at Stivers! They had me in n out with a truck I’ve always wanted. Avery Blackall did an outstanding job and I’ll definitely recommend this dealership to my friends 🤘🏼

name: Alex Gibson
text:
My first Google review. Wish I could give them 5 stars because that would mean I had a great experience. But buyers BEWARE of the management here. If you buy a used car or happen to get a lemon, you may be in for a huge headache. I bought a used vehicle on Friday, 2/19, and on Monday 2/22 I already had it being looked at by my mechanic. This was AFTER I tried to get management to respond. Vehicle's fuel pump wasn't working, and Stivers said DO NOT tow it to our place because we don't work on Rams. My mechanic found out that the fuse box had been heavily rigged to send extra juice to a failing fuel pump, just enough to get it to run. He said that this was easy to spot once they looked at it, meaning that Stivers doesn't check out the vehicles well enough. I have tried, repeatedly, to get them to return my call and talk to me about the issue, hoping they will at least acknowledge it. And additional $2000 later I've got the van back, but NO thanks to Stivers. My mechanic, on the other hand, is going to get the SECOND Google review I've ever written, and it will be 5 stars.

As of the date of this review, we are just a month past the date I bought the van, and I still have not heard from them. This was after my salesperson and the manager BOTH said he would get back in touch with me. They have three different phone numbers, and not a single message or call has been made. I will keep trying, and I hope that someone in their marketing group will see this and get back with me. I'm hoping there has been some minor miscommunication there and that I will get some assistance and help covering the expenses soon. If that happens, I'll be happy to re-evaluate my rating.

name: Macy Jones
text: Very friendly and quick service! Everyone I spoke with was exceptionally nice and very helpful! It was my first visit but not my last!

name: Gary Curl
text: Had a very good experience at Stivers Ford for a service visit. This was my first visit since buying a new Ford Fusion there. I went to get an oil change, but found out I could get what they call "The Works" for a full checkup of my car. The service advisor, Edward Jeszka, was very friendly and helpful in explaining what all they would do. I had made an appointment online on their site which was very easy and convenient. I got there at my appointment time and Edward greeted me, and they went right to work on my car. Even with all they did I was only there a bit over an hour. Very satisfied and looking forward to letting them do my service. Another perk is that I had earned points for buying a new car there so all this was done with points and cost me nothing.  Check them out (formerly Adamson Ford) if you are in the market for a car.

name: Frels on Rock
text: This was a truly 5-Star, first-class experience for us with Stivers Ford, and specifically Demetrius Denson, who was phenomenal!  We had a virtual urgent vehicle situation where we had to buy a car ASAP, and Demetrius delivered in every facet, from the moment he politely answered my phone call, all the way through to driving off the lot 24 hours later.  Top-notch customer service all the way!

name: Jared Danks
text: Had a great experience,  part took longer than expected but Tim and the team helped me with transportation and kept me updated on the progress. Overall friendly and courteous staff.

name: Jennifer Gowers
text: I had a wonderful experience with Stivers Ford! From Shelby Parker's responses from my first inquiry, to Aaron Cummings follow up & seamless sale to Asher's financial paperwork completion. I will recommending Stiver to all of my friends and family and am thrilled to be once again in the Ford family.  My father owned a dealership for over 30 years and I'm not easy to please! This is a GREAT review I promise!

name: melinda ridge
text: Jessica was so helpful to me. Service fast and everything explained well. ☺️

name: katrina smith
text: Great experience. Staff was great the went above and beyond to get us what we wanted. We will be back.

name: Kimberly Pardue
text:
C J   Our sales guy is great ! He  helped us w/our new explorer purchase.

Will NEVER go to them again!

text: It was a great experience service was great employees were considerate and polite and respectful will b having all future service done here two stand out employees were so awesome and helping me Jessica and Mark they really put customers first which is a great thing. So anybody needing service done to your car weather its major or just a oil change i recommend Stivers Ford of Birmingham A1 service

name: Rick Elliott
text: Overall experience was good but Avery was awesome and did a great job.  The finance manager, Asher and Avery stayed very late until the deal was done.   Very happy
