text: I would definitely rate it a 5! Everyone was so nice and they helped me get exactly what I wanted and in the price range I needed. They also stayed over later to finish up my sale. It was amazing customer service and atmosphere in general. Thank you all so much. Especially a thank you Avary Blackall, David Agee, and Shelby Parker. The customer service went above and beyond.

text: Great Service Department experience. Will definitely visit again. Mr. Parker made the whole thing a breeze.

I got so fed up with HAVING TO CALL THEM for updates only to be told I’d get a callback THAT NEVER CAME!!! Coworker placed his car at another Ford for a new transmission 2 days after I left mine at Stivers and he got his back in 4 days! Took mine to Ernest McCarty and got it back the same day!!!! Was also promised a loaner vehicle and never got it!!! If you want your time wasted and your car not to be fixed, go to this place!

Mark was my service advisor he was a pleasure to work with on figuring out what was wrong with my car he was very professional polite and knowledgeable
Great Customer Service

text: Shelby and Seth were very helpful!! Great people here! Drove away in an awesome ride, and I would definitely recommend them!!

name: Richard Church
text: The entire team at Strivers Ford in Birmingham was a pleasure to deal with. I had Seth Kelosky as a sales rep and he was awesome! He knows the vehicles inside and out and was very easy to work with. Great service all around.

name: Joseph Fields-Weldon
text: Saw a FB post about a special event. I called the dealership and spoke with the internet sales manager, Seth. I told him my credit score, the vehicle I had for trade and the payoff amount, and what I was looking to do. He told me that given the details, there would be no reason they couldn’t get me in another vehicle. I left work 30 minutes early to get their and it was the BIGGEST WASTE OF TIME. Sales people Eddie and CJ got the details that Seth already had and it took them five minutes to come out to the lot that had very little inventory to let me know that they couldn’t help me. What’s interesting about this is that I tried to do business with them late last year and had a totally different set of circumstances at that point. I was told that I would have to do the same thing they told me last year when I was in a different set of circumstances. Just go to another dealership. If they don’t want to deal with you then they hand you the same lines.

text: Worst experience trying to buy car I've ever had in the over 50 years and over 40 cars/ suv/trucks of buying and paying cash for. Please find a honest and reliable dealer before letting some car shark take your hard earned money.

12/17/2020 update - - payoff has been made and I've received reimbursement for the additional payment.

resp.text: Mr Hannum, the we apologize for this situation. We were able to investigate your complaint and find out that there was a miscommunication between the two stores we have and the accounting department. I have the tracking numbers for both the pay off and reimbursement fir your automated payment. I left a voicemail not to long ago, please call me back at your earliest convenience or email me at lpearsall@stiversonline.com. Please accept our sincere apologies sir.

name: James Nelson
text: I had the worst experience I have ever had trying to buy a vehicle here.  I drove 2 hours to the dealership to look at a used van.  When I arrived I noticed that the van had a rear liftgate which prohibits the installation of the ladder rack I was going to add to it.  I told them it wouldn’t work for me, then inquired about a new van.  We couldn’t find it so my salesperson said let me check on this.  A few minutes later he came back and said it was at a lot a few blocks away.  He asked me to wait amd said he would go get it. I agreed.  Thirty minutes later I was still waiting.  I called my salesperson to see what was going on and got no answer. I finally left to start the 2 hour drive back home.  I texted him and told him I was leaving.  He said he found the van and would send pictures.  Frustrated at this point, I thought I can see pictures online but whatever.  This was on a Monday.  Finally, on Saturday I agreed to the terms of purchase.  They asked when I could come down and sign the papers and I asked them to email them and I would sign them electronically.  The manager didn’t know if they were setup to do that yet but would check and let me know.  (Another reviewer on here said they did their hole deal online!) I didn’t hear back from him so I reached out on Monday and asked for a proposal with the final terms.  I got that email and did not hear back from them again. I reached out to them on Friday and was told they were trying to figure out how to get me the paper work.  I didn’t hear back so Saturday evening I told the manager that I wasn’t going to purchase the van.  So far, I haven’t gotten a reply.  We had a deal, the financing was approved and yet it seems they were not interested in finishing the deal.  I have never experienced such at any other dealership.  I spent three years in automotive sales, when someone said we’ve got a deal we were always quick to get them signed sealed and delivered.  I’m still stunned by this outcome.  I would recommend you go to Long Lewis where you will find a much more pleasant car buying experience.

name: PABLO TREVINO
text: Great Experience working with Shelby Parker

name: Danielle Crownover
text: This dealership is definitely good, has great people but management wise no. So for as Ed (The sales Manager, Lydia (training coordinator I’m guessing) And Daniel Flatt (General sales manger) so I was offered a position for Stivers Ford of Birmingham and started training, you have to do hours of fmc dealer/starts training to be certified to sale cars. So not only did I spend a lot of time doing these test I only had 4 left to do when I came in today. So I was stopped by Ed and Lydia and they proceed to tell me I’m fired.. I’m very confused as to why cause I was not given a proper reason! So all day today I’ve been trying to get in touch with the general manager to ask why I have been fired, because Daniel was texting me asking me about the test, and how everything was going. Apparently Ford isn’t the right fit for me and I’m not a good candidate according to Lydia. I have 7 years of customer service and the job offers training so I’m not sure how that made sense. In my attempt to contact the General sales manager aka Daniel Flatt he has ignored me and now blocked my number. So I’m hoping this gets the dealerships attention. I was really counting on this job to help me pay my bills that are late (due to covid haven’t been able to find work) not only would it have helped paid my bills. This Ford Dealership has very poor management skills and I want to know why Daniel Didn’t come and talk to me or anything and why I spend countless hours and days working on test just to be fired.

I was in dire straights for a vehicle as my other one was just totaled.  They were so compassionate towards my needs and felt like they honestly cared about my situation.  I cried in both happiness and relief.  Adamson Ford has a great sales team and I would recommend a purchase from there to all of my friends and family.

I don’t appreciate this dealership nor how I was treated. Please do better when someone is ready to buy your vehicles. Shouldn’t have to wait, you guys should’ve been waiting on me.

text: I decided to try this place due to it being so close to me. They changed the oil as I requested but this is my first time being charge for tire rotations and I've been to a lot of different Ford dealerships in different states due to traveling with my job. Then for the multi point inspection...I know they just press buttons. Boxes were not marked correctly. I have existing codes that have not been squared away and they marked it in good condition. If you know your car and just need a quick oil change this is a decent place...customer service was good and they completed the oil change, but if you don't know your car and need recommendations on what's really going on with your car...dont bother with this place. By the way...I am in the military and work on mechanics all day everyday so this review is legit!

name: Brittany Alexander
text:
We had a wonderful, stress free experience at Adamson Ford.  I highly recommend you visit there as well.  We saved thousands of dollars when compared to the other local dealership that uses a “no haggle” best price advertising campaign.

Our salesman, Justin Gray, was not only extremely knowledgeable about the details of the vehicle we were looking for and the various the trim packages, but also he essentially had the dealerships’ inventory committed to memory, so he was able to find us just what we needed in no time at all.

Justin didn’t employ any over the top sales tactics, and we never had to haggle.  Instead, he worked with us to find the right vehicle for us and went above and beyond to get us the best price possible (in reality,  not just in an advertisement). Justin was able to deliver on every request / concession we made.

The sales manager, David Galbraith,  was very polite and went out of his way to meet us.  He also went out of his way to get us more money for our trade-in. Refinancing folks and paperwork process was mind bogglingly fast.

You should definitely stop by and don’t be tricked by the claims of “no-haggle,” “best price” on the sticker type dealerships.

name: Chelsie Cox
text: THANKS TO THE WONDERFUL DEALER AT ADAMSON FORD HEAVY. HE MADE MY CAR BUYING EXPERIENCE THE BEST. GO SEE THEM TODAY

text: The service was excellent. The technicians. Name was Tim. Very good customer. He took the time and explained what was done on my car. Walked me to my car and made sure i got out properly.    Thank you so much tim.     And thank you Adamson.

text: I had a great experience at Adamson Ford with my new car purchase. Matthew did a great job throughout the purchase experience, and had great follow-up.

Thanks to all involved!  Sorry it took so long to get this done.

text: I brought my Edge in for an alignment and gas door repair. I had to bring the car in twice due to a crooked steering wheel and the car pulling hard to one side after they said it was complete. They rotated the tires and didn’t bother to check tire pressure after the service. Each wheel had drastically different air pressure even though matched them all to the factory recommend psi before bringing it in. One was around 12psi over the recommended setting. They do offer a shuttle to work which was convenient but overall the service experience was average and slightly frustrating.

text: I am always in excellent hands when working with Norris Underwood. text: Phil Powell exceeded our car buying experience. He first listened to my needs and wants. This allowed him to know which direction and approach he needed totake. No one likes spending hours in a dealership and he respected my time by doing all the necessary work prior to me getting there. He was extremely patient with me as I decided on the “perfect” truck for me. After he showed me a few vehicles, I still wasn’t satisfied and I apologized. He assured me that his goal was to make me happy with my purchase. He was true to his word. They didn’t have the vehicle I wanted on their lot but he found one and they went and picked it up just for me, AMAZING!!! I would highly recommend Phil to anyone looking to purchase their next vehicle. Everyone that I interacted with at Adamson was beyond professional and polite. After visiting 2 previous dealerships, one of those my husband and I had purchased 2 vehicles from, didn’t even compare to the experience we had with Phil.  The experience, knowledge and level of customer service he provided was remarkable. Keep up the great work Phil!!!!

name: Joseph Hollis
text: BUYER BEWARE!!! This review is for the service department. I tookk my truck in almost 2 weeks ago for a complete diagnostic.( On board computer - air conditioning etc) and was told that my car had no issues other than the air condition unit had a leak and my fan belt needing replacing. I allowed them to replace my fan belt and by the end of the day they told me my truck was no longer starting and then proceeded to tell me my engine computer was showing a bunch of error codes right after they told me everything was fine. They told me it was a timing chain which is extemely fishy considering they told me everything was fine. They supposedley had and engine guy look at the car all this week and I have yet to hear anything back from them further raising suspicison. They have made some many promises and have not fulfilled one to me. This is the worst car experince I have ever had. PLease dont use the service department.

resp.text: I am so sorry for your experience. I do understand that you brought this into our service department after purchasing somewhere else. Unfortunately sometimes with the age of the vehicle it can slow the diagnostic process and with no previous history of repairs this can take time. I will be sure and have someone contact you today with an update.

text: Phil “the deal” Powell was super great! Best car buying experience of my career!! He found me the car I wanted within my budget! He was so personable and I did not feel pressured into buying anything!! I’m definitely going to him for the next car my family needs!

text: Norris Underwood made this stressful process as seamless as possible! Enjoyed working with him and the team at Adamson Ford and I thank them for hooking me up with a new ride!

name: Vy Tran
text:
Awful service department.
Took my car here to get the recall issues dealt with. We called to make an appointment and they said no appointments necessary just go in be ask for Brad. Well we went online and made an appointment anyways to make sure. The appointment was made 2 weeks in advance,  I brought my car in for 9am (when they open) and was told to come back around closing business hours. I never got a single phone call all day which is fine. I call around 3 to see if it's done. Told I would be called back but no one did. Called twice more around 4:30 and was finally told they didn't have a chance to work on my car. Never would have known my car hadn't even been touched because no one bothered to call me to let me know what the status  was. No apologies or offer to get me a back up car to drive because they needed it the next day and couldn't guarantee they would have time to do it then either. Had I not called I wouldn't have had a car and they would have closed without telling me it was or wasn't done. Terrible customer service.

text: Everyone was pleasant from the time I walked in until the deal was done. My salesman, Tommy, did an AWESOME job. He worked hard to get the deal where I needed it to be so we could get it done. Would definitely recommend this dealer to friends and family.

text: My wife and I spent a long time researching where we should buy our first car together. Of all the dealerships we visited, he was the first person who actually listened to us. This was the biggest purchase of our lives thus far, and he understood that. He was considerate, knowledgeable, a lot of fun. We were not the easiest customers, and our indecisiveness couldn't have been to deal with. Our Focus has been outstanding. Make no mistake about it, we won't waste time next time. David will be our first and last call!!!

name: V
text:
Their service department is usually pretty good. They're pretty inconsistent with their info tho. My first oil change I got it changed at the mileage the first guy told me to buy when I got my car back I got a whole lecture about how I waited too long and I I could have messed my car up. The guy was talking to me like I was incompetent I didn't appreciate that at all.

Today I went and scheduled some services and a skinny white lady with short hair and tattoos that works there backed into my car with someone else's car. If that doesn't make me not want to go back then I don't know what does. She didn't apologize or acknowledge the fact that she backed into my freaking car. My car is fine but after this service that I scheduled this might be it for me going to them.

Every other time they're fine tho I guess. But then again I've only been 3 times so, yea.

name: Ryan Harrison
text: We wanted to test drive a used vehicle, when we show up we end up waiting 30 minutes and they put us in a new vehicle instead, not to mention the back door handle was broken, very embarrassing for them, I would hope. We were not pleased with this bait and switch. We took out business elsewhere.

resp.text: Mr. Harrison, I apologize on our behalf for your less than pleasant experience. Our aim is to provide an unparalleled buying process for our customers and I’m as disappointed as you are that we’ve missed our mark. I will use this as a training opportunity with all parties involved to prevent a future occurrence. I welcome your feedback and would love to have open dialogue with you about your experience in hopes to enhance yours and future customers’ experiences with Adamson Ford. Please contact me via email at rhoward@adamsonford.com or by phone at 205-271-4730 at your convenience. Regards, Robert Howard, General Sales Manager.

text: Just got rushed off the phone by the service department when I tried to get an estimate for a basic transmission fluid change. text: I had a very positive experience at Ford. Fred came out and helped my husband and I with our vehicle purchase. I like to walk in with an expectation of receiving exceptional customer service as any proffessional business provides and Adamson Ford clearly provided that. The building inside and out exemplifies a respectectable, clean and neat appearance (which I am particular about). They took their time to answer all our questions despite the store being past the closing time. I believe Fred and his team gave us the best deal that night. After our purchase, he followed up to give me the status of our vehicle and even delivered it to my work with a smile on his face. I was so excited and felt complete with the whole process despite my busy schedule. Fred and Adamson Ford Team, thank you for that positive experience!

name: Chuck Thomason
text: Overall I have been pleased with Adamson Ford.  Considering I have purchased an Explorer, (2) EDGE Limited's, and most recently a 2014 F150 4X4 w/ Off Road Package from them.  Not to mention they handle all my service work.  It is with my F150 purchase were I am becoming more than frustrated and if not dealt with at this dealership will be moving any and all my business ASAP!  My F150 has 23K miles on it which are almost all highway miles.  Complained about the truck vibrating at speeds over 70 mph which has yet to be fixed or even addressed to my knowledge.  I also have a vibration when braking and was told my rotors need to be turned at a cost to me of about a 170 bucks.  Now I have owned many a car/truck and have never had to turn the rotors after only 23K miles of usage.  In fact, I don't think I have ever had to turn rotors on a car/truck I have purchased since I had a real job.  I am not sure if this dealership is willing to lose my business over 166 bucks, but I am damn sure willing to move it for that amount.  FORD - recognize you have an issue as this same complaint has been posted a number of times.

I was shocked that I was even able to get approved because of my credit, but he found a bank that would work with me and he got me in the payments that I wanted with the deposit I had down.  I am absolutely in love with this car, and Bob made my car buying experience excellent. This car dealership is awesome, they didn't make me feel pressured and he didn't let me down. I would gladly send everyone I know to them. Thank you so much for your excellent hard work.

text:
Terrible their after the sale service is horrid at best they hang up on you never return calls guve you other dead end numbers to call back at a later time worst exp.ive ever had I bought a barely used truck which had been on their lit over 30 days .When I returned home to Florida
After waiting 21 days I had not received the info to have my tag transferred now after months of wasted phone calls they tell me they don't have a title nor does the party whom they purchased from almost 5 months later and i have a new truck i still cant legally drive ...Ok I wanted to update this to let everyone know several months later and they rectified the situation and gave a very sincere apology for all the trouble.I was also able to get a tag finally .Also I want to say that my salseman Phillip was great my only issues at all here were the title thing and their front desk could be better the communication was the only other negative .

name: sjstrick0124 x
text: My daughter bought her first vehicle from Adamson Ford 3 months ago. She was sure to search for a car that had a carfax and found several she liked online. We live over 100 miles from Adamson Ford and probably could have bought a car a lot closer...but because of the online reviews...she chose Adamson. Well this week, she had to have her entire brake system replaced at the local Ford dealership. They told her that the underside of her car was completely rusted out. This happens when cars are from Northern regions where they use salt on the roads to melt ice....or beach towns where there is natural salt in the air. in places like THAT....it is standard practice for a mechanic to check the underside of a car. My daughter's car was a late model 2014. The vehicle was most likely purchased at auction and came from another area in the US outside of Alabama. She was not expecting to have to pay for  new brakes and other rusted out parts on the bottom of her car. She called Adamson Ford about it and they said it was not their problem. Typical! They are nice and polite BEFORE you buy from them....but if you have a problem they change mighty quick. This was my daughter's very first vehicle. She tried to ask all the right questions and STILL got burned. No help from THIS dealership! And worse...no acknowledgement that they did not check the bottom of the car before selling it to an unsuspecting 21 yr. old kid. Yeah...I am one angry parent! Shame on Adamson Ford. We will NEVER use you again. You COULD have helped with the cost a little. But once you made the deal...you abandoned your customer!

name: Myrtle Adams-Davis

name: shaesdad56
text: I just got home from buying a 2013 Ford Pickup from Adamson Ford and wanted to share some details of my experience with them. My first contact with Adamson Ford was on their internet site. The internet personnel were all very cordial and accommodating. They knew the answers to all my questions and answered them very quickly! When I decided exactly what I wanted I was invited to come in and sign the necessary forms to complete my purchase. When I arrived, I was greeted by the salesman and shown the vehicle. My salesman had the keys for the truck and I test drove it. Matt was my salesman. He answered all my questions and addressed all my concerns. The questions that he wasn’t sure about, he was able to get prompt answers for. Everyone that I spoke with at the dealership was extremely friendly and accommodating. I am impressed with Adamson’s sales team and will send them all the business that I can! They are great folks and I will surely be back to deal with them in the future!!!!

name: Josh Adkins
text: I’ve been getting my F150 serviced at Adamson Ford for about a year now.  Recently, while I had a very good friend working there, I purchased a promotional service package. Shortly after that....I feel, that she was wrongfully terminated from her position due to another female employee being “personal”. NOT ONLY did they deny my service when I went back for my scheduled truck oil change/ tire rotation, but other current employees (which are also friends of mine and very good people) were asked to not associate with me! I am FULLY aware ANY business has the right to deny someone their service, however Adamson Ford’s motto is #AlwaysAdamson #AlwaysFamily and I’m sure I wouldn’t be the first to tell you that it was NOT how I was treated that day due to these circumstances. I have been in the car business for years at 2 different dealerships and I encourage anyone that is in the market that wants to have a great experience in purchasing a like-new/used vehicle or needs quality service to PLEASE contact me.

text:
Adamson is terrible ! They have nasty attitudes and usually do not know what they are doing . I get the run around everytime I go; no one can ever provide direct answers or resolutions for situations . Jessica acts like she doesn’t want to work there and George the supposed “service manager” fails to comply with Official Ford Motor Letters went out .

After calling for a month checking on my recall position with no answers as to when I could drop my car off or when parts would be in , knowing and understanding that I was leaving for the holidays ...they decide to call me the day that  I’m boarding my plane to go home from school . Being in california I told them there was no way I could get them my car and turn my rental in .... they insisted they’d begin to start charging me . Unacceptable . Called corporate, they said it was in the offices hands several times and each time everyone had an attitude . Now as stated earlier I have an official letter from Ford saying they are not to begin charging for the rental UNTIL they have my car ,AND my repairs are complete, not until 7 days AFTER my car repairs are complete are they to begin charging .

Do better !

name: Rebecca McCay
text:
Can’t even patch a tire!

After many frustrating experiences at Adamson, this was the final straw. I have been a customer of Adamson for years out of sheer connivence to my house. This past week I took my car to get my tires aired up and was told by my service advisor that I had a nail in it. They told me it was an easy patch and I was sent on my way. A day later I walked out to my car to head to work and my tire was completely flat! Turns out they just removed the nail and aired it up and sent me on my way. I came to a ford dealer expecting to receive a dealership experience but obviously customer service is not what this dealership prides themselves on. Only visit this dealership if you want half assed work and mediocre service.

Upon purchase when given the key I had to ask for the second set. They said there wasn't one and the fob I received had no battery in it. I bought a battery and it still doesn't work. I ask if they would give me a full tank of gas they said no only $10 Not a good experience.

text: Trebor was exactly the help we didnt even realize we needed. He was extremely helpful. My wife needed a new car. MANNNN Trebor got us the same car we would have bought at the used lot, only difference is this one had 7 freaking miles on it. And the payments are less than they would be at the used place. And they hooked us up on the down payment! They even had an insurance agent on site. Mario helped us find the right coverage through multiple companies and multiple price ranges. name: Junior Wolff
text:
Filled out form on KBB to sell my Hummer H2. This was my first time using this option.

Once I put info based on my assessment of condition I submitted the form.

About 15 mins later I received a call from Mathew at Adamson Ford. This was the second call so the KBB system works.

Mathew asked me to give them a shot to see if they could meet or exceed the KBB offer that was sent to me.

I drive it to Adamson and meet Mathew 15 mins later they exceeded the KBB offer quote and I even negotiated a ride home. Cannot beat that for service.

name: Inger Jackson
text: Very courteous and professional.  There was no pressure and I got exactly what I wanted

name: Gina Reynolds
text:
My grandfather owned a dealership my whole life (I’m 30) up until 3 yrs ago when he sold it for retirement. My father managed the parts department there up until 2 years ago (because the new owners were crooks & he couldn’t stand to work with them any longer). Since, my sister bought a car from Adamson & was very happy with her experience. So in December, I decided I’d start getting my oil changes there. I work @ UAB so it was convenient around my work hrs. My 1st experience was great! The guy that took care of me made sure the guy that drives the shuttle got me to work by 7:30. I picked up my car & paid leaving as a happy customer. My 2nd experience wasn’t so great.
I decided I’d get my tires rotated as well. A different man took my order & I went inside to sign up for the shuttle service. That same man comes in & openly complains about how several people are out with the flu & says “this is just going to be a great day” in an annoyed, sarcastic tone. As I’m signing up for the shuttle, the guy that drives said, “shuttle rides don’t start until 8”. To that I responded, “The guy that was here last time made sure I was at UAB in time to clock in & you were the one that drove me”. He said, “that should be fine as long as a lot of people don’t sign up”, & then after asking if I should walk 15 minutes later, he finally drove me (10 minutes after asking). Mind you, I didn’t have that problem at all the 1st time. As I’m working I get a call from them saying “Ma’am when we were rotating your tires we noticed that they are in big need of changing. Can we put on new tires for you?” He didn’t expect me to not be naïve & mindlessly say yes (being a single young female). I asked, “How much would that be” & he said, “Oh uh…$1,600”. I said, ”Absolutely not!” & instead, took my car to a place in my hometown & got 4 top brand, brand new for $950.
Last week I decided to give them another shot thinking if that guy was there that served me the 1st time, it should be okay. I saw him, but was served by a man I hadn’t seen before. I ordered an oil change & tire rotation. I avoided the hassle of the shuttle & made the 15 min walk to work. I got a call from a female saying “when we were rotating your tires we noticed a nail in one of them & if we took it out the hole would be too big to patch, can we replace that tire?” I, of course, said no & to that she said, “okay well we can’t rotate your tires then”. I told her that was fine. But I thought the whole thing was strange because I hadn’t once received a “low tire pressure” warning. When I went to pick up my car I noticed on their write up they documented the nail. So I took my car to my parents so dad & his friend could look. NO NAIL! I tried calling the following day to speak with the manager, & the lady that I spoke with was rude, & on top of that, REFUSED to give me her name. Apparently, they don’t have a general manager, they just have a manager per department. I wanted to be fair thinking maybe the head guy didn’t know about his workers, but if it’s the manager of the parts department, they know, which is why I’m turning here. I don’t think it’s fair to try to screw people over to get more money, my grandfather didn’t run his business that way. & the best thing I can do is caution other people from going. At least to the parts department.

text:
Thank you again, Antonio Glenn for going the extra mile to make sure that my experience at Adamson Ford ended on a good note. It's been a year since you sold me the Mustang I've been dreaming of since I was in the 5th grade, and you still dropped everything to help me today! When I get ready to buy my F-150 (can you tell I love Fords?!), I will definitely trust you with that purchase. In the meantime, I will be sure to tell all of my friends about the professionalism, honesty, and integrity that you display.

Thank you Cal Swann for taking the time to explain my service issue. Thank you for understanding that every customer has value and deserves to be treated with respect. When you sacrifice to purchase the vehicle, religiously bring it to the dealership for service, hand wash it and clean it inside and out every weekend, (and name it -shhh!) you worry about the "health" of your car. Thank you for not being too busy to address my concerns! I'll see you in 5,000 miles!

text:
Let me start by saying I understand the term as is no warranty. It may not mean anything to your business but you have lost a family of customers. I bought a used truck from this dealer and waited four days for them to do a "safety inspection" on it. Two months after buying this truck I find out one of the shocks on the rear is ripped out of the frame. I also find out I have to replace all four of the break rotors because they have been turned down to thin.... Oh and btw I have not made the first payment on this truck. So I do not recommend buying anything from Adamson Ford..

*****An update on my situation. I want to retract the above statements. Given the chance to fix the troubles Bob Willard and Mike Gargone contacted me and were very nice and and professional. They addressed all of my concerns. I also want to thank Jarod Rowe and the service department for the work they did. I am very thankful for their help! I will be glad to deal with them again!!

name: Steven Lane
text: Bought a 2016 Chrysler 300C from this dealership with less than 600 miles on it -- asked for a Carfax but was given an AutoCheck and was told that this was much more thorough than a Carfax -- this showed that the car had never been in an accident, etc. and was totally clean (the salesman, Bob Willard assured us of the same and said the vehicle would go through more than a 100 point inspection making sure that the car was in perfect condition.  After getting the vehicle home and detailing the car thoroughly, we noticed that the passenger door sounded hollow (like an empty garbage can).  We immediately took the vehicle to Myer's Auto Collision to have the car inspected --after inspecting it, he found the vehicle to have had over $4000 worth of damage (passenger back door had so much bondo it couldn't be read on his meter, passenger door was a hollow shell (aftermarket part - not factory), the hood had also been replaced with aftermarket part - not factory and wetsanded and painted with trash in paint.  We also ran a Carfax and found out that the vehicle had been wrecked and the airbag was deployed and vehicle was undriveable and had to be towed.  We went to Adamson and talked to the manager, Mike Gargone on 2 different occasions about this and was told he would not cancel the contract and also told us that the vehicle had not been wrecked.  He also said that the vehicle had been bought at Manheim Auction in Georgia and that they do not have to divulge the information of any wreck to a vehicle and that he did not know the vehicle had been wrecked (we have had reliable sources to tell us this is not true -- that if a vehicle is wrecked and airbags are deployed, it has to be divulged to the buyer).  It is hard to believe that a supposedly reputable dealership that is well known in the city of Birmingham would conduct business the way they have.  We feel we have been violated by fraud, lied to, and deceived.  How would they as experts in cars not know this vehicle had been wrecked and how are they not liable for not divulging that information to  us as a consumer? How can they get away with this?

name: Skyler Clark
text:
Updated
I wouldn't treat my dog the way they've treated me. I have bought 2 vehicles from them. David G. The sales guy, Hes great, but the problem came when I bought an 06 f-150 from them in November of 2015. I purchased an extended warranty through them and less than a week later I cancelled it (after I read the fine print). So I am entitled to a full refund. So the dealership sends off the forms to cancel the warranty while I do the same through email. I have to talk to David A in financing and he is the problem. He told me for a month that he hadn't heard from the warrenty company and I told him that I had and that they told me that they cancelled the warrenty. So he tells me to send the email stating that to him and so I do. Well then he says that I have to sign the form and him send it in and I reminded him I had the form so I sent him the original form I sent to Alpha warrenty. I finally tagged him in an email with Alpha Warrenty to get it all straighted out. Then Alpha calls me and asks who to send the email to, I Tell them David in financing and so they DO!!!! I call Adamsonford again and guess what? David in financing tells me that he got the email and is sending the check. Thats was December 14, 2015. So I call my finance company on Jan. 4, 2016 and they haven't received a payment. I email David in financing again and he says he's waiting on alpha from a fax he sent on December 14, 2015. I call the dealership and now someone else is "helping" who I won't disclose at this time. And he is waiting on a response from alpha warrenty. ...... really??? I've BOUGHT 2 VEHICLES FROM THIS PLACE AND WAS GOING TO AGAIN..... all I can say is things better go right or I will discourage everyone on every page and website, social media and whatever else I can. If a customer calls with a problem you don't just email or call the place then leave it, you keep calling or emailing until it's fixed especially when I buy more than once......
After submitting this review I had a lady contact me named Melissa. She looked into the problem and found that they never sent the money for the warrenty. She has been a pleasure to work with and I wish I would have done this sooner. Sadly I won't be buying another vehicle from them as long as David A. In financing or Shaun(syan) works there as their apathy and laziness is appalling. Everthing is sunshine and rainbows until u have a problem.Everyone else at adamsonford is great, but if the finance guy who pushes a warrenty doesn't send the money, what else are they not doing?

name: Ray Askins
text: I got my ok on loan from USAA for vets, they are under Car truth , they ask for make and model. once you type that, it list the dealers that have agreed to be honest on cost with them and to sell it for a decent price.i had 4 Ford dealers, my car appeared 100 miles off so I took the agreed price to Adamson.. I was looking for a Ford Fusion, Chevy Impala, or Acura or Subaru. I wanted a great quiet,  ride but I wanted the new safety features. I was surprised when I looked at the Ford Fusion Titanium. It will parallel park for you, just settle into spot on its own, has back up camera with warning sounds go green ,yellow, and red when back gets closer , it will slow with cruise on its own slower than setting to keep from hitting car in front, it has blind spot detectors on both sides of car that light up in outside mirror, then vibrate steering to keep you from coming over on car in blind spot. I actually tested this stuff. it is super quiet and smooth as silk. i still am amazed at the remarkable job Ford did with the Fusion Titanium , It is Metallic Red Bronze, with leather heat and air-conditioned seats. best car I've seen and now own, Take my advice, drive a 2016 Ford Fusion Titanium , and if you were looking for THE CAR, you will buy it. BobWillard and Shaun Yan helped me and there are no nicer folks to deal with.

name: Tony C
text:
This dealership fraudulently ran my credit without even speaking to me whatsoever. Had a female employee call me and tell me that i was approved for credit acting like she was from ford motor credit, then a man named Phil called telling me i was approved also and not a pre approval an actual approval , then basically says the he couldn't get ahold of my boss so i couldn't get credit , So they basically got my licence and check stubs and credit report under false pretences pretending to be from Ford Motor Credit , They are absolutely nuts messing with peoples lives live they are nothing, ive never been so humiliated by a car dealership in my life and they should face some sort of consequences
I even asked my boss if they called and he said no , so in so many words Phil didn't try to verify my employment, and Phil says he looked the business i work for in the phone book, does he not know there are lots of other ways to have a business phone and the business i work for just started a few months ago so it wouldn't be in a phonebook , He may want to talk to the customer before he dismisses a customer that hes made a fool of, Phil doesnt know how To do his job very well obviously and some woman named Alauna does his dirty work too, they should both be ashamed for what they did.

name: Brittney B
text: Norris went over and beyond to help me get the car of my dreams. For once I didnt feel used or misled. Thanks for everything Adamson Ford.

name: Meeka Acklin
text: My experience with them keep gets worse & worse. On March 25, 2016 I was at malfunction junction when my 2007 Mustang just stopped working. I pull over & immediately use my road side assistance then google the nearest Ford dealership because I was fairly new to the area. I called the service department & not sure who I spoke with but he was friendly & I told him I would be having my car towed to them for diagnostic work within the hour. He said ok bring it in. Ok me & my boyfriend  follow the tow truck there & speak with Jay in service. He assured me that would try to figure it out. After sitting there for 30min, he comes to the break room & said it was my battery. I said ok replace it. Did that & it still would not crank up. So him & another gentleman almost tore up the starter by trying to crank it & I literally had to say PLEASE stop doing that. So it was around 3 on a friday so Jay stated that the head tech was out & leave my car for the weekend & Monday he will call me by 10am & let me know whats the problem. I said ok. Well Monday I called in to work so I could be available about my car. I called him at 1030 am because I hadnt heard from him. He said they still working on it & try back at 12. Called at 1230pm & he replied they cant get my car crunk up so they dont know whats wrong. That they will start from the bottom up to find the problem.I said I need to know the problem because thats my way to work. He said as long as it doesnt crank up they cant find out. My dad is a retired mechanic so I ask why is that because most car issues often doesnt allow the car to crank up. He said they know its misfiring but dont know from where. I said the diagnostic machine should tell you. I was informed then they dont have a diagnostic machine to put my car own. I about passed out. I said well how long will this take because I need a car to get to work & I need to know what to do. Jay told me that I may need to call enterprise because they dont give out loaner cars & cant fix it until they figure out whats wrong. I said my dad & brother fix on cars & I have never heard of a Ford dealership not able to tell me what was wrong with a Ford car. Jay reply was why dont you get them to look at it. I was just angry. So I called my dad & brother out of town & they instructed me to get to a local Pep boys to get diagnostic testing. Informed Jay of this on that Monday that a tow truck would be to get my car that Tuesday morning. Jay informed my road side assistance that I owed them no money but I didnt want to use them because I didnt want to pay them. By now I was livid. My boyfriend was too. So the following day the tow truck driver went there 2 times to get my car for them to not be able to get my car because it wasnt accesible. I called them & informed them if they dont have my car accesible a 3rd time I was coming with the police. 3rd time tow truck was able to get my car.  Took it to Pep boys & they had a diagnosis within 2hrs. Well in May I left the same review on their facebook page & whoever is over it apologized & offered me 2 free oil changes. Well I have tried to get these 2 free oil changes for me to get there at 2pm on June 28th for Jay to yell out they done with oil changes for the day. So the gentleman at the desk asked could I come back the next day. I said I work all day. He said can you drop it off at lunch. I said sure. I called the next day at lunch to say can you bring it at 2pm. I said no. Tried to bring it again then no time. Its sad that you offer me something for bad service to get bad service on the free offer as well.

name: Rita Jablonski
text: I was ripped off royally. I needed a fuel filter change; that's it. A couple of hours later, I received a telephone call that my vehicle required new spark plugs, cooling system flush, and some other items: $800. I am new to the area and I did drive my 2003 Mountaineer from PA to Alabama, so I gave the guy the benefit of the doubt. When I picked up my vehicle, I was told that I needed a new serpentine belt--which I had replaced three days earlier at Oil Express (which are great, by the way). I was also told that my rear tire required new ball bearings at a cost of another $800; if the "rods and spindles" were damaged, that would cost another $800 ($1600/total). I declined. I went to Phelco Automotive and the same repair cost $400; the mechanic saw no damage or corrosion to the spindles and rods, and had no idea why Adamson wanted to replace them. AVOID THIS PLACE YOU WILL BE RIPPED OFF!!!!!!!!

name: Doug 9044
text:
I contacted these guys to install the rear glass and a new windshield in my 93' Toyota Paseo, nothing out of the ordinary. They come out during normal business hours so I was unable to be there but I had my father let them into my garage. The guy called me and said he's never seen this type of car and he was " pretty sure" he could put the front windshield in right but knew he could do the back. I just told him not to install the front since he had no clue what to do. Then he install the rear with their universal molding, which is fine since Toyota didn't have it available anymore.
I got home and looked over the job, it was horrible. He had installed the rear windshield way out of sort, it wasn't positioned in the opening evenly as it is extremely too far forward, to the point that there's a 3/4 inch gap at the bottom. Even with the gap they only installed their molding around the top and two sides leaving the huge gap in plain sight.
I called the owner the next day and he was horribly rude, told me he wouldn't come back and to take it to a paseo specialist. Clearly I took it to a hack.
I wouldn't recommend this company to my worst enemy, not only do they perform poor installations they owner has a filthy mouth when speaking to you about it.

name: kay martin
text: Mr Cassidy and his son came to my house but had the wrong glass but the next day it was raining  so I went to Mr Cassidy's house and he installed my windshield both Mr Cassidy and his son were very nice and professional. I would highly recommend Cassidy Glass great price and service

text: Cassidy gas no idea how to conduct buisness he is also a liar i called to get a price check on my car he told 165 when i called back to get the service he then told me over 200 i also rried to call the day before like he he rold me to with no return call and no one answered the phone i will taking my car else where for service i would strongley reccomend some place else

text: Really fast service

name: Connor Gaston
text:
They replaced glass on both of my cars. One car wasn't a problem. My SUV was more difficult. I asked for good quality glass and I'm not exactly sure what I got.
I wanted the glass installed following the instructions spelled out in the factory Service Manual. When I would explain to the installers how it NEEDED to be done they pushed back by saying that was not necessary. My SUV has a specific way to install the windshield that is out of the ordinary. If steps aren't followed then its going to leak. They assured me that it wouldn't leak the way they did it and I really did not want to put that to the test with their way of doing it. I supplied my own new factory gasket for the job. If I had not had that they would have reused the 20 year old gasket that was glued to the old windshield. The manual says to use a NEW gasket.

All the glass installers I have delt with to get this done have just about all been the same. They are payed by they job and want to get done and on to the next job. I care about my car and if I'm gong to pay to have this done I want it done right. As the customer they need to consider that I probably have a good idea what I'm talking about and should listen and absorb what I'm telling them because I didn't want it to leak and I know they didn't want to have to come back and fix it.

My experience with the installers that came today was the reason for the bad rating. I don't appreciate their attitude towards my instructions I had for them.  I walked inside to get cash to pay them while they were working and quietly came back outside to hear them talking about me and how I was trying to micromanage them.  One of the guys actually told me he could see why they other companies didn't want to do the job. Which was a rude thing to say. He couldn't handle I wanted things done a certain way (the correct way).

I'm sure most windshields are simple and easy to replace. If you have any specifics on how your car windshield should be done like I did then skip this company. Along with Cassady and Self. They were worse.
